{"step_by_step_thinking": "GIC stands for Glass Ionomer Cement, a type of dental cement. ZnPO4 refers to Zinc Phosphate, another type of dental cement. The tensile strength of a material refers to the maximum amount of tensile (pulling) stress that it can take before failure. After 24 hours, the tensile strength of GIC is generally considered to be less than that of Zinc Phosphate.", "answer_choice": "C. Lesser to Znpo4"}
